Understate: The claim may understate the potential impact of Obamacare on people's ability to keep their long-time doctors.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that people will not be able to continue seeing their long-time doctors under Obamacare.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for why people may not be able to keep their doctors, such as changes in health care plans or job turnover, which can happen even without Obamacare.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that people on the same health plan for 15-20 years is a common occurrence, which may be a problematic assumption.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that people can already lose access to their doctors even without Obamacare.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by not providing a clear and consistent argument or evidence to support the assertion.
